summary: Slalzan is the modest, landlocked capital of Slor'th. It sits apart from formal trade, with no established routes connecting it to other burgs and no port to draw river or sea traffic. As the seat of governance, it hosts the state’s council and keeps the state’s seal, while serving as the principal center of worship for the Slalzanian Deities. The populace is chiefly Aj'Snaga with a notable Kobblin minority, and public life blends council edicts with temple calendars. Isolation has fostered self-reliance and tight-knit neighborhood bonds within the mix of the state’s dominant biomes.
localColor: Days begin with temple chimes and smoke from altar fires to the Slalzanian Deities, answered by Aj'Snaga call-and-response chants in the streets. Festival ribbons and carved way-stones mark processional paths through town, since there are few true roads leading out. Market days are small but lively: handworked tools, dyed cloth, and preserved staples change hands more than exotic wares. The Kobblin quarter keeps low hearth-fires burning at dusk, a sign of welcome and watchfulness. Couriers wear the state’s colors and carry staff-tokens instead of saddlebags, for messages more than goods ply these paths.

notables.name: The High Custodian
notables.role: Head of the civil administration of Slor'th, presiding in Slalzan over law, levy, and the state seal.
notables.secret: Quietly solicits surveyors to chart a first dependable road out of Slalzan, despite resistance from conservative temple voices.

notables.name: Keeper of the Central Shrine
notables.role: Chief celebrant of the Slalzanian Deities and arbiter of festival calendars and oaths sworn at the altars.
notables.secret: Maintains a small, hidden annex honoring Aj'Snaga Spirits to ease tensions, fearing backlash if the syncretism is revealed.

notables.name: Aj'Snaga Voice on the Council
notables.role: Representative for the Aj'Snaga majority, mediating customary law with state statutes.
notables.secret: Plans to formalize neighborhood mutual-aid compacts into recognized civic bodies, which would dilute temple influence over relief.

notables.name: Elder of the Kobblin Quarter
notables.role: Speaker for the Kobblin artisans and labor bands, known for fair weighing and careful record-keeping.
notables.secret: Holds old route-marks and memory lists of safe byways to distant Kobblin kin, maps that could anchor a new trade link.

factions.name: Council of Slor'th
factions.motive: Maintain stable rule from the capital, legitimize decrees, and cautiously improve overland connectivity.
factions.strength: Legal authority, clerks and heralds, custody of the state seal.

factions.name: Temple Circle of the Slalzanian Deities
factions.motive: Preserve ritual primacy and keep the capital’s identity bound to the deity pantheon.
factions.strength: Public devotion, control of festivals and oath-taking, influence over moral disputes.

factions.name: Aj'Snaga Hearthbands
factions.motive: Safeguard communal customs, mutual aid, and neighborhood autonomy within the capital.
factions.strength: Numbers, tight kin-nets, and practical know-how for living in the local biomes.

factions.name: Kobblin Guild-Circle
factions.motive: Win equitable standing for Kobblin families and reopen remembered byways for modest trade.
factions.strength: Skilled craftspeople, precise bookkeeping, and quiet kin contacts beyond the state.

adventureHooks.title: The First Road Out
adventureHooks.setup: The Council discreetly hires escorts and surveyors to chart a reliable overland route from Slalzan.
adventureHooks.complication: Proposed paths cross revered markers and procession routes; the Temple Circle threatens to halt works unless rerouted.
adventureHooks.reward: Road-rights for tolls or land grants near the new way, plus council patronage.

adventureHooks.title: Silence on the Processional
adventureHooks.setup: Pilgrims moving between two shrines have not returned, and no trade messengers come that way either.
adventureHooks.complication: Factions blame each other; searchers must navigate unmarked stretches where landmarks double as sacred sites.
adventureHooks.reward: Temple favor, blessings sworn at the altar, and a public commendation from the council.

adventureHooks.title: The Doubled Seal
adventureHooks.setup: A decree bearing the state seal conflicts with one already posted in the square, threatening the council’s legitimacy.
adventureHooks.complication: Hardliners accuse the Kobblin quarter of forgery; the truth lies in custody lapses and a hidden rival within the archives.
adventureHooks.reward: Access to records and a standing writ of introduction throughout Slor'th.

adventureHooks.title: Bridging Belief
adventureHooks.setup: A syncretic festival is planned to honor both Slalzanian Deities and Aj'Snaga Spirits, hoping to calm tensions.
adventureHooks.complication: Provocateurs aim to spoil the rites, risking street clashes between devotees and council guards.
adventureHooks.reward: Gratitude from both neighborhoods and the right to petition in the temple court.
